Sentencas: Powders of Gadolinia doped Ceria (Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-delta (GDC)), a promising electrolyte material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell has been prepared by solution combustion (SC) synthesis.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Variation of fuel to oxidizer ratio in the synthesis results in the GDC powder with varied powder characteristics.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Fuel deficient combustion reaction results in GDC powder with smaller crystallites size but with larger agglomerates; whereas reaction with near stochiometric amount of fuel leads to the GDC powder with larger crystallite size and smaller agglomerates.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Powders with large agglomerates possess required particle size, shape and flowability characteristics appropriate for plasma spraying.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Electrolyte coatings fabricated from the synthesized plasma spray grade powders exhibit superior inter splat adhesion and conductivity (similar to 0.02 S/cm at 600 degrees C).
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Dense nature of the coating is ascribed to the complete melting of the porous GDC particles in the plasma flame.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders

Sentencas: Powders prepared with stochiometric fuel are suitable for tape casting process.
Titulo: Microstructure and electrical properties of plasma sprayed Gd0.15Ce0.85O2-δ coatings from solution combustion synthesized flowable powders
